definition: The relative intensity of a spot test result on a three grade scale: 1, 2, 3 where 3 is the highest.
Minimum Number of Individual organisms as calculated from recorded parts (e.g. whole insect equivalents)
A legacy data type used in BugsCEP to represent partially quantified and incomplete lists, e.g. quantified up to 50 individuals and then estimated.
Data type is not clearly defined, could be a combination of quantification, presence/absence and semi-quantification or qualification. Beware of using data of this type for quantification.
The absolute number of the counted element (e.g. seeds, fossils) present in the sample.
Sample ages in uncalibrated values consisting of mean and error (+/-). Requires calibration to compare with calendar years.
Sample ages derived from counted rings, layers or dated events.
Mix of data specified on a scale of 0 to 5 where 0 is absence and 5 is maximum amount of property, and data classified on the presence of a property (e.g. Granite = tempering by granite present)
Data classified according to a set of predefined categories (e.g. temperature classes; tempering material classes)
Data expressed as a percentage (i.e. out x of 100)
The element/fossil is present in the sample, but not quantified (numerical classification where 1 = presence)
sample ages calibrated to calendar dates
A date which may include other information than the age, such as season, terminus and/or error margin.
Geographical location given as approximate values or text. May include multiple levels, text strings and exclusions (e.g. not Poland).
Multiple datatypes from one method. (e.g. multiple isotope types from masspectrometry)
